name: The Westin Miyako Kyoto

reviews.text: This was our favorite hotel on our 3 week trip. We completely lucked out and got a fantastic deal on Expedia so we only ended up paying about $112 a night and then when we checked in they had upgraded us to their newly renovtated deluxe rooms. It was awesome!! The rooms were large and the bathroom was huge! If you're looking for "Western" rooms in Japan, this is where to find them. We stayed here for 4 nights and could have easily stayed much longer. The grounds are beautiful, the hotel is HUGE and extremely well kept. The staff are very helpful. The only downfall is that the restaurants in the hotel were super expensive so we always had to walk somewhere else. It's quite easy to walk around Kyoto, the city itself is breathtaking. However, the hotel location is a fair distance from all the major areas. If you're up for a good walk, then you can reach anywhere by foot, we even walked to the Castle which is in the other end of town. The subway system is extremely easy to use and there is a station just down the street form the hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: If you're planning a trip to Kyoto, this is the place to stay!!
reviews.title: Good and Bad

reviews.text: This is such a difficult review to write; the hotel is OK and the area good. I would stay there again, but it has the potential to be so much better.
reviews.title: Tired and Old and out of the way.

likes.disliked: — Outdated decor, not maintained well - stained carpets, gross mattress, ugly exterior; poor and slow service

reviews.text: The hotel itself is fine, reasonable sized rooms, recently refurbished and with a good bathroom. The only regret is that they still have cathode ray tubes. It's a huge hotel. Breakfast was included but every morning you'll have to wait in line for it. They have a system to record your name and will call you in strict rotation. The buffet is lukewarm at best. A good selection but even when a fresh batch of bacon is brought out from the kitchen it isn't better than tepid. Still it's free and set us up for the day.
reviews.title: Excellent for a stress free experience

likes.disliked: — Lack of electrical power sockets in the bedrooms..take your extension lead and screwdriver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge is a joke. Could you book us a table at this restaurant please. It's full and that was it. No alternative suggestion. She just couldn't care less. For Japan this was truly atrocious. Another example, we would like to go down to Gion to try and see any geisha's that may be walking about. Could you recommend a street we may see one on. Her reply, tell the taxi driver you want to go to best Gion area. The taxi driver dropped us outside a strip club. Use your guide books or get everything booked through the concierge of your Tokyo hotel if on a tour. Don't whatever you do, rely on the concierge here for anything. Maybe you want to forward your bags to your next destination - courier shut she says.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - and base for exploring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a great deal through the hotel website (half the standard rate for a superior room) and then got upgraded (room was slightly bigger). We stayed for 4 nights.
reviews.title: Comfortable rooms, great facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were truly "heavenly beds" - we didn't want to get up in the mornings! (Downside being they were twins, rather than a double). The room had a coffee percolator (we were cheap-skates and bought food from a bakery the night before so we had breakfast in bed!), fridge, TV and iron. It was very spacious and was light and airy (but also cosy). The bathroom was large and luxiourious - although I found the "heavenly", dual-headed shower a bit too much! We felt like we were on our honeymoon here.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: There was a good swimming pool, jacuzzi and gym and some nice walks around the hotel. There were loads of restaurants, but a little expensive for our tastes (we preferred to eat out). There's a great one-man coffee shop a few doors down from the hotel - it's very small, but the old man is very friendly and makes coffee the old-fashioned way. This was a highlight of our stay.
reviews.title: Felt like celebs!

likes.liked: — Spacious room, polite staff and luxury

reviews.text: Close to the tube station. We couldn't find the check-in at Kyoto station, but we did take the courtesy bus back. Be warned, it fills up very quickly and you need to queue at least 15 mins before it leaves.
reviews.title: Incompetent unhelpful staff

reviews.text: There are two great walks - one to the north towards the Silver Pavillion and one to the south towards another temple (I forget it's name, but it's a biggy). East Kyoto is a little bit out of the way, but the best part of town to stay in (in my opinion).
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a big hotel with the feel of a convention or tourist hotel. Rooms are boring and tired (old TV, old bathroom fixtures, worn fabric). Service is spotty. Everything is perfectly adaquate, but nothing special at all.
reviews.title: big, tired hotel with minimal character, not up to Westin standards

likes.disliked: — in major need of a big rehab

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This would be a decent Sheraton, but it is a reach to consider this place up to Westin standards.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

likes.liked: — cleanliness, proximity to subway, good English by staff

reviews.text: We paid extra for club level, but the club is very small and often crowded (in fact, the staff warned me the night before that i need to get there early if i want a seat for breakfast, so they obviously know this is a problem... here's a simple solution: sell fewer club-level rooms).
reviews.title: The Charm Lies Within

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Miyako Kyoto for 5 nights on our honeymoon to Japan. I had picked the hotel based on reviews I had read. It didn't really live up to my expectations. As others have mentioned, the satellite check-in is very hard to find in Kyoto Station- go past the McDonalds and you will eventually see it on your right. We received an upgraded room upon check-in-- our room was pretty basic and it didn't seem to be worth the money. It was nothing special by any means. We had to pay for Internet. The place was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. However, the restaurants were ridiculously expensive at the Westin!! The food quality was poor and the prices were outrageous- after our 1st day, we made the decision not to pay for any more meals at the hotel (breakfast was included but got boring very quickly- I've had buffets in India and Thailand that put this buffet to shame) We liked that the hotel was right next to the subway and tried to use the subway as much as possible. In some ways it was nice to be out of the hustle and bustle of Kyoto at night, but it also can feel isolating and you end up being stuck with the hotel's dining options. We stopped to use the bathroom at the Hotel Okura in Kyoto and I was very impressed with that hotel, decor-wise and location-wise. I would recommend that others stay there instead of the Westin, which I can assure you is overrated.
reviews.title: Not what it used to be

likes.liked: — The view, once we had one

reviews.text: I have stayed in Westin Miyako Kyoto several times and would recommend it to anyone without qualm. While I too have experienced inconveniences from some of the hotel staff like other reviewers, the overall good experience outweigh the hiccups. The Concierge is always ready to help. Their attentiveness to guests' requests may have caused delay to others waiting to be served, but the quality of advice and efficiency once attended is second to none. Worthy to mention is that I find the Chief Concierge just about the most knowledgeable and patient concierge I have encountered from my travels across the globe. The Sales Department has always put in their best efforts in meeting my accomodation requests, whether for myself or for friends / colleagues / business partners. The room I always choose to stay faces the mountains, which is beautiful and tranquil. Through the years, Westin has upgraded the dining facilities, introducing more fine dining for customers. I am never a fan of hotel dining, so I have never tried any of the establishments.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel - if you book through Expedia upgrade your room!
Special and quirky
reviews.text: We were in Kyoto for a brief holiday. We'd booked a double room, but were fortunate to be upgraded to an amazing suite.

The suite was HUGE! It was large by any standards, but in Japan, hotel rooms tend to be small to middling. This was an apartment: It had a foyer, a living room, a very big bedroom, a dressing room almost the size of a regular hotel room, and an upgraded bathroom with a Washlet, separate shower and tub, and double vanity.
reviews.title: mixed experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was incongrously decorated in rather bare-bones 1960s American style, with crushed-plush sofa set and pink nylon carpet. We couldn't figure out if it was a meticulous re-creation down to the wall-paper pattern, or if it was really 1960s vintage. Either way, it was quite comfortable. There was a great view across the town to the mountains.
reviews.title: Not the Westin standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What made the hotel really special was an amazing Japanese garden perhaps 100 years old, with a wonderful completely natural-looking waterfall, and a hillside trail that went up the mountain, through the trees, climbing up to a tiny Shinto shrine and then a look-out point. There's also a chapel on the premises, and a wedding was in progress while we were there.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, but.....
Lovely Kyoto
reviews.text: Kyoto isn't short of fantastically beautiful sights, but if you have an hour to spare while staying here, it's worth checking out the garden and the trail. This hotel was special, with a historic feeling that is not immediately apparent in the bland every-hotel lobby.

aka: The Westin Miyako Kyoto Hotel Kyoto
description: Western-style 11-story Hotel located amid Japanese gardens, 5 miles from train station & 31 miles from Kansai Int'l Airport.
